podcast_details.episode_transcript: As-salamu alaykum wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh. InshaAllah we will go over the last Báb of Kitab-ul-Iman again. Qawlul Nabiya Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam, the statement of the Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam, religion is well wishing. Well wishing for who? Lillahi for Allah, wali rasoolihi and also for his messenger, wali'a immatil muslimina and for the leaders of the Muslims, wa ammatihim and also the common Muslims or their masses. So in other words, well wishing for who? All of the Muslims. This Báb, Imam Bukhari gives it the chapter heading by mentioning the hadith. Which hadith? Which is mentioned over here, that adinu and nusriha. However in the Báb he doesn't actually mention the hadith. There are two hadith that are mentioned under this chapter heading and neither of these are the one that is mentioned in the chapter heading. Why is it so that Imam Bukhari just referred to it and he did not actually mention it? Because he used it as a heading but this hadith, it does not meet the strict conditions of Imam Bukhari. Meaning the strict conditions of authenticity. It has been recorded by Imam Muslim which shows that this hadith is not weak. It is definitely authentic. However it does not meet the strict criteria of Imam Bukhari. Which is why he did not mention the hadith, however he referred to it. He used it as a chapter heading. And the statement of Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala, went as long as they are well wishing, sincere to Allah and his messenger. If you look at the statement which is in the chapter heading, which is adinu and nusriha. That religion is nusriha. Does it mean that our religion only includes nusriha? No. Our religion includes many many things. The deen, iman requires many things but of the things that are part of iman, or of the things that our deen demands from us is nusriha. Then why is it said adinu and nusriha, religion is nusriha? To show how important nusriha is in our religion. To show how important it is in our deen. This is just like the Prophet ﷺ said, al-hadju al-afaa. Does it mean that hajj is only the day of alafaa? No. If a person only goes and stands at alafaa, is his hajj complete? No. Then what does it mean by al-hadju al-afaa? That alafaa, the ritual of alafaa is the most important one. It shows how very important it is. So similarly, a nusriha is a major part of our deen, it's a major requirement of our deen, it's a major part of iman. And nusriha to who? للاه وريرصوله ولي أإم مت المسلمين وعمتهم To all. Nusriha, well wishing for who? For everyone. For Allah, His Messenger, for the deen. And in the narration of Imam Muslim, we also learn that nusriha to also the book of Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala. To his kitab, meaning to the Quran. This shows to us that our deen teaches us that we should have well wishing for everyone. That we should want good for others. This deen of ours, it creates positive feelings in a person, not negative. That people should become merciful, kind, generous, and not selfish, and not oppressive. And we see that the most deserving of our nusriha is who? First of all, Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala. And also, His Messenger. But if you think about it, does Allah need our nusriha? Does the Messenger, S.W. need our nusriha? No. They don't require well wishing from us. Because whether we well wish for them or not, we cannot harm Allah and His Messenger. For example, if you're not sincere to a person, if you don't want good for them, can you harm them? Yes, you can. But can a person harm Allah and His Messenger? They cannot. So what is meant by nusriha for Allah and His Messenger? This is well wishing for who? Sincerity for who? The deen of Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala. And nusriha for Allah and His Messenger means obeying Allah and obeying the Messenger. Because if you think about it, nusriha, what is it? It is to want good, right? For who? For the other. To be sincere to the other. Nusriha, to be sincere to the other. Tawbatan nusuhah, sincere repentance. So it is to want good for the other genuinely. So when is a person genuine to Allah and His Messenger? When is he sincere to them? When he will be obedient to them. So nusriha to Allah and His Messenger is being obedient to Allah and His Messenger. Similarly nusriha to Allah is that when a person worships Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala, he does so with khudoor, with fear, with humility. And that he has hope of Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala's reward and fear of his punishment. Similarly nusriha to Allah means that a person prefers Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala above everyone else. Above everyone else. He gives Allah the highest priority. podcast_summary: The podcast discussed the concept of Nusrah or well-wishing in Islam. It emphasized the importance of well-wishing for Allah, His Messenger, the leaders of Muslims, and all Muslims. The episode explained that Nusrah means wanting good for others and showing sincerity towards them. It highlighted that well-wishing for others is a major requirement of the religion and an act of worship. The podcast also mentioned the importance of seeking forgiveness for those who have passed away and the need to have Nusrah for the entire Muslim community. Overall, the episode stressed the significance of Nusrah in Islam and its role in creating positive feelings and actions towards others.
podcast_highlights:
In this podcast, the key topics discussed are:
- The importance of well-wishing for all Muslims
- The meaning of naseehah (well-wishing) for Allah, His Messenger, the leaders of the Muslims, and the common Muslims/ the masses
- The significance of naseehah in Islam and its importance as a part of iman (faith)
- The conditions for true well-wishing and how it is displayed in different aspects of life
- The importance of seeking forgiveness for a deceased leader and the benefits of forgiveness in general
- The role of knowledge and teaching in well-wishing and the responsibility to impart knowledge to others.
